item.title: Avatar Legends: The Fighting Game is getting a closed alpha test
item.content:encoded:
Gameplay Group International has announced that its recently announced Avatar Legends: The Fighting Game is getting a closed alpha soon, though no release date or way to apply has been confirmed yet. The announcement is also accompanied by some gameplay which shows Aang, Korra, and Zuko fighting each other, with Korra also entering the Avatar State towards the end of the footage.

Avatar Legends: The Fighting Game will launch with 12 characters on the roster, though this roster will be expanded through a season model. Players will also be able to select support characters that will be able to provide assistance in fights, and there will be a single player story mode too. The development team also mention a movement centric “Flow System” for the gameplay, crossplay, and a possible name change in the future. The characters confirmed so far are  Aang, Korra, Zuko, Katara, Toph, Sokka, and Azula, with Korra currently being the only character from Legend of Korra announced while the others are all from The Last Airbender.

Avatar Legends: The Fighting game is set to release in 2026 on PC via Steam, PS4, PS5, Xbox Series XS, and Switch 2.

Source: YouTube

item.title: Over The Hill has been confirmed for consoles
item.content:encoded:
Funselektor Labs Inc has confirmed that its offroading game Over The Hill be releasing on PS5, Xbox Series XS, and Switch 2 after the game has been released on Steam.The studio also announced a physical release for PS5 and Switch 2, with both a standard version and a collector’s edition being made available.

Over the Hill is a game about offroading in which players drive vehicles from the 60s to 80s either alone or in a group, while dealing with the challenges that come with navigating some tough trails. It is not just the landscape that will provide a challenge, with Over the Hill featuring dynamic weather and a day/night cycle. The different areas are inspired by real world locations, each filled with different objectives. Completing these objectives will unlock new vehicles, upgrades, customisations, and cosmetics. And, you can capture the scenery through a photo mode.

The standard physical version of Over The Hill will include the game, a window cling decoration, and a digital copy of the soundtrack. The collector’s edition will include the game, window cling decoration, rocking dashboard car standee, embroidered patch, lanyard keychain, winched collar pin, and a vehicle poster. Funselektor and Strelka Games said, “Designed for fans, this edition is packed with collectibles that celebrate the charm of off-road exploration. From the winch enamel pin that nods to dealing with rugged terrain, to the rocking car acrylic standee that can bring a sense of movement to your desk, every item feels like a keepsake from a different offroad adventure.”

A release date for Over The Hill has not yet been confirmed.

Source: Press Release



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/10/28/over-the-hill-has-been-confirmed-for-consoles/

item.title: DON’T NOD’s Aphelion gets a brand new trailer
item.content:encoded:
Developer DON’T NOD has released a brand new trailer for its sci-fi adventure, which is due to be released in 2026. The brand new trailer confirms a second playable character to provide a different perspective to Ariane, and that new character is fellow astronaut Thomas. The two characters have different ways of dealing with things, with Ariane being more physical as she moves around while Thomas uses his mind to piece things together due to picking up an injury.

The new trailer for Aphelion also shows a creature native, named The Nemesis, to the planet Persephone stalking both astronauts, who cannot fight back. Both Ariane and Thomas will need to hide and move stealthily to avoid detection. Ariane and Thomas are not together in this journey but are looking for each other after crashing onto the planet of Persephone.

Aphelion is due to be released for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S in 2026.

Source: YouTube

item.title: Monsters Are Coming! Rock & Road is releasing in just a few weeks
item.content:encoded:
Tower survivor roguelite Monsters Are Coming! Rock & Road has been given a release date by Ludogram and Raw Fury, with the game coming on November 20th. There is a demo available on Steam, which will remain available even after the game is launched.

In Monsters Are Coming! Rock & Road you need to defend a moving city from an endless army of monsters that want to tear the city down. To fight back, you need to gather resources like wood, stone, and gold to use to invest in defences, upgrades, and abilities to take on threats from small monsters to big bosses.

Monsters are Coming! so it’s time to get this addictive Tower-Survivor rolling

In our preview of Monsters Are Coming! Rock & Road, Stefan wrote, “Monsters are Coming! Rock & Road, to use its full title once more, is absolutely the kind of game I can see myself losing hours and hours to. Tower defence and bullet heaven survival games are already so satisfying in their own right, and their progeny promises much the same. I’m definitely very keen to play more, with Ludogram currently holding a closed beta test to refine it even further.”

Monsters Are Coming! Rock & Road will be released for PC and Xbox Series X|S. Additionally, it has been verified for Steam Deck and the Xbox ROG Ally.

Source: YouTube



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/10/28/monsters-are-coming-rock-road-is-releasing-in-just-a-few-weeks/

item.title: Warhammer 40,000: Boltgun 2 will let you play as a Sister of Battle
item.content:encoded:
The Adepta Sororitas are coming to dish out the Emperor’s justice in Warhammer 40,000: Boltgun 2, with the boomer shooter sequel letting you choose between the returning Space Marine Malum Caedo, and new character Nyra Veyrath, one of the Sisters of Battle.

The Sisters of Battle are more than capable of holding their own in battle, despite having nowhere near the augmentations of the Adeptus Astartes – it’s all mad religious fervour and zeal powering their combat prowess.

In Boltgun 2, Nyra doesn’t have the same level of armour as a Space Marine, but she’s much more agile and can use speed, precision and just setting everything on fire to get ahead.

Boltgun 2 will follow on directly from the end of the first game, giving you a new branching single-player campaign to rampage through, blasting heretics, Chaos Space Marines, demons and everyone else that gets in your way. There’s new Blooletters, demonic Juggernauts and more on the way. The new campaign will visit new worlds, going from the heights of a hive city to the mangrove swamps of a jungle.

Warhammer 40,000: Boltgun launched in 2023 and was a great slice of old school FPS action, blended with the increasingly popular Warhammer 40,000 universe. In our Boltgun review, Dom said, “Warhammer 40,000: Boltgun is a brisk, brutal boomer shooter and another great reason for a visit to Games Workshop’s science fiction theatre.”
